title: Website Availability Monitor, 0.18 released
author: rultor
content: readme.md does do?sixnines.io is hosted service validate prove availability your web service sites. read blogpost more details:sixnines.io, website availability monitor. badge is available :http://www.sixnines.io/b/3b05e836?style=flat&format=pnghere, style parameter be either round flat. format parameter be either svg (106x20) png (424x80).dynamodb schema sn-endpoints table contains registered end-points:fields: login/h: github login the owner uri/r: uri the endpoint, e.g. "http://www.google.com/?q=hello" id: unique id the endpoint active: "yes" it's alive, "" otherwise created: epoch number when was added hostname: host name the uri, e.g. "google.com" pings: total amount ping's 've done far failures: total amount failed attempts state: either "" or "down" updated: epoch of most recent update this record flipped: epoch of recent state change expires: epoch when has be pinged again log: detailed log the recent failure favicon: uri the faviconsn-endpoints/unique: (index) id/hsn-endpoints/hostnames: (index) active/h hostname/rsn-endpoints/flips: (index) active/h flipped/rsn-endpoints/expires: (index) active/h expires/r sn-pings table contains recent pings:fields: uri/h: uri the endpoint pinged /r: epoch of ping local: ip address where were pinging remote: ip address the endpoint reached msec: many milliseconds took code: http response code (2xx means success) delete_on: ttl attribute dynamodb ( to delete item) to contribute?
